title: Constructivist Blended Education for Foreign Language Teachers' Information Technology Literacy

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary foreign language teaching methodologies and experience with digital devices
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented constructivist approach using virtual learning environments (OpenSim) and Sloodle, emphasizing social, cognitive, and teaching-presence interactions based on the Community of Inquiry (CoI) framework

learning_goals: Learners can utilize basic IT tools required for foreign language classes (e.g., virtual whiteboards, voice chat) in virtual learning environments
Learners can design foreign language education scenarios by applying principles of digital content design based on constructivist pedagogy
Learners can plan online activities (discussions, collaborative projects) that promote learner interaction in blended learning environments
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
